item.title: Stock market holiday: Are BSE, NSE open or closed today for Christmas 2024? - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Stock Market Holiday: BSE and NSE Closed for Christmas 2024

Publication Date: December 25, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

India's stock exchanges‚Äîthe BSE and the NSE‚Äîare closed on December 25 for trading due to Christmas festivities, aligning with other global markets observing the holiday.

  • The BSE and NSE will also close their segments for commodity derivatives, currency derivatives, and electronic gold receipts.
  • This is the last trading holiday of 2024, with the exchanges observing a total of 16 holidays this year.
  • On December 24, the stock markets closed slightly in the red after a volatile session.
  • Nifty 50 and Sensex faced pressure due to high dollar strength and rising bond yields in the US, leading to sales by foreign institutional investors (FIIs).

Notable Statistics

‚ÄúNifty 50 ended at 23,727.65, declining 25.80 points, or 0.11%.‚Äù
‚ÄúSensex closed at 78,472.87, down 67.30 points, or 0.09%.‚Äù

Investors are currently prioritizing safety over returns in this economically turbulent context.

item.title: Oil prices up by 1% in thin pre-holiday trade | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Oil Prices Increase by 1% in Thin Pre-Holiday Trade

Date & Source: December 24, 2023, Reuters

Oil prices rose by over 1% on Tuesday due to a better short-term outlook amid thin trading leading up to the Christmas and Hanukkah holidays.

  • Brent crude futures settled at $73.58, increasing by 1.3%.
  • U.S. West Texas Intermediate crude futures ended at $70.10, up by 1.2%.
  • FGE analysts predict price fluctuations as market activity decreases during this season.
  • There are indications of increased oil demand in the upcoming months.
  • China plans to issue 3 trillion yuan in special treasury bonds to stimulate their economy.
  • The U.S. economic data is mixed, indicating solid footing despite weaker consumer confidence.
‚ÄúGiven how short the paper market is on positioning, any supply disruption could lead to upward spikes in structure,‚Äù FGE analysts noted.

In conclusion, with impending holiday trading and supportive economic measures from China, oil prices are expected to see fluctuations but retain some upward momentum.

item.title: IPO allotment frenzy for DAM Capital, Mamata Machinery, 3 others, triggers meme fest on social media: Check top picks | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
IPO allotment frenzy for DAM Capital, Mamata Machinery, 3 others, triggers meme fest on social media: Check top picks

Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: Live Mint

The excitement surrounding the allotment of five IPOs, including Mamata Machinery and DAM Capital, has ignited a wave of memes and jokes on social media as investors eagerly await their allotment status.

  • Five mainboard IPOs are set for allotment, including Mamata Machinery and DAM Capital Advisors.
  • Investors are checking allotment statuses through registrar portals.
  • Social media is filled with humorous memes related to the IPO frenzy.
  • Refund processes for unallocated shares will begin on December 26, with listings expected on December 27.
  • Investors can use their PAN Cards to check their allotment status.
‚ÄúNumber of people waiting for the allotment of the Mamata Machinery IPO!üòÇüòÇ‚Äù ‚Äî Ninja Hattori, December 24, 2024

This frenzy reflects the growing enthusiasm in the stock market and the significant public interest in new investment opportunities.

item.title: Telcos call Trai's plan to split data, voice packs as 'regressive' - The Economic Times
item.description:
Telcos Protest Trai's Voice and SMS-Only Tariff Packs as Regressive

Publication Date: Recent | Source: The Economic Times

India's leading telecom companies have criticized the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India's (Trai) new regulation mandating separate tariff packs for voice and SMS, arguing it will hinder technological progress and negatively affect 2G users.

  • Trai's mandate requires telecom operators to introduce special tariff vouchers for voice and SMS-only.
  • Telcos claim this regulation undermines the current trend of offering voice services for free within data bundles.
  • This move could restrict access to essential online services for 150 million 2G users.
  • The regulation comes at a time when major companies like Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are expanding their 4G and 5G networks.
‚ÄúTrai's current regulation seems to suggest it is not keen on these remaining 2G users experiencing the benefits of the data-centric Digital India initiatives,‚Äù said a senior telco executive.

In conclusion, telecom companies argue that Trai's new plan could reverse progress towards digitization and keep many users from accessing vital digital services.

item.title: Upcoming IPO: WestBridge Capital-backed IndiQube Spaces files DRHP with SEBI to raise ‚Çπ850 crore via IPO | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Upcoming IPO: WestBridge Capital-backed IndiQube Spaces files DRHP with SEBI to raise ‚Çπ850 crore via IPO

Date: December 24, 2024

Source: Live Mint

IndiQube Spaces Ltd, a workplace solutions company, has filed preliminary draft papers with SEBI to raise ‚Çπ850 crore via an initial public offering (IPO).

IndiQube Spaces IPO Details

The IPO comprises a fresh issue of equity shares worth ‚Çπ750 crore and an offer for sale of ‚Çπ100 crore from promoters.

Utilization of Proceeds

  • Capital expenditures for establishing new centres: ‚Çπ462.6 crore
  • Repayment of borrowings: ‚Çπ100 crore
  • General corporate purposes

Company Overview

IndiQube, founded in 2015, manages 103 centres across 13 cities with a total area of 7.76 million square feet.

Its client base includes companies like Myntra, upGrad, and Siemens.

Financial Performance

The company reported a total income of ‚Çπ867.6 crore in fiscal 2024, up from ‚Çπ601.2 crore in fiscal 2023.

Board Expansion

Recently, IndiQube added four independent directors to its board, enhancing its governance and strategic direction.

item.title: Number of non-farm firms grew 13% to 7.3 crore: Govt survey | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
India's Non-Farm Firms Surge by 13% to 7.3 Crore: Government Survey

Publication Date: New Delhi, October 2023

The number of non-farm firms in India has grown to 7.34 crore, reflecting robust recovery and growth in the unincorporated non-agricultural sector post-pandemic.

  • 12.84% increase in non-farm firms reported for the period October 2023 to September 2024.
  • Manufacturing accounted for over 20% of the gross value added, with trade at one-third and services at 44%.
  • Employment in these enterprises rose to 12 crore, nearly 10% higher than the previous year.
  • Women-owned establishments increased from 23% to 26.2% compared to the previous year.
  • The average wage per worker saw a 13% growth, with manufacturing leading at over 16% increase.
‚ÄúThis wage growth serves as a catalyst, strengthening the labour market, enhancing productivity, and fuelling broader economic demand.‚Äù - Ministry of Statistics

The substantial growth in non-farm enterprises indicates a positive trend in India's economic recovery, empowerment of women in entrepreneurship, and improvement in employment conditions.

item.title: Another boost after bumper IPO, listing gains! International Gemmological Institute - Mega Rs 1347.17 cr acquisition - ET Now
item.description:
International Gemmological Institute Acquires Two Companies for Rs 1347.17 Crore

Updated December 24, 2024 | Source: ET Now

The International Gemmological Institute has acquired a 100% stake in IGI Netherlands B.V. and International Gemmological Institute BV for approximately Rs 1347.17 crore, following a successful IPO listing.

  • Acquisition includes IGI Netherlands B.V. and International Gemmological Institute BV as wholly owned subsidiaries.
  • IGI Netherlands B.V. operates in Dubai, Israel, Thailand, Hong Kong, China, and Egypt.
  • International Gemmological Institute BV was established in 1975 and operates in Belgium and the USA.
‚Äú...we would like to inform you that the Company has acquired 100% stake in IGI Netherlands B.V. and International Gemmological Institute BV...‚Äù

This acquisition marks a significant expansion for International Gemmological Institute, solidifying its global presence in the certification and accreditation services market for diamonds and gemstones.

item.title: Elon Musk's xAI raises $6 billion funding from BlackRock, Nvidia, AMD, and others | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Elon Musk's xAI Secures $6 Billion in Funding from Major Investors

Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: Live Mint

Elon Musk's artificial intelligence company, xAI, successfully raised $6 billion in a Series C funding round from prominent investors, including BlackRock, Nvidia, and AMD, to enhance its AI infrastructure.

  • The funding was announced via xAI's official blog.
  • Series C funding will be used for advancing infrastructure and R&D.
  • This marks the second funding round in 2024, following a similar $6 billion Series B round in May.
  • Key participants in this round include a16z, Fidelity, and Morgan Stanley.
  • Major initiatives from xAI include the launch of Colossus, the world's largest AI supercomputer, and Grok 2, its second language model.
‚ÄúThe funds from this financing round will be used to further accelerate our advanced infrastructure, ship groundbreaking products that will be used by billions of people.‚Äù ‚Äî xAI

Looking to the future, xAI is developing Grok 3 and other innovative products to enhance how individuals and businesses engage with technology.

item.title: India‚Äôs growth trajectory to lift in H2FY25 because of resilient domestic private consumption: RBI bulleti - The Economic Times
item.description:
India‚Äôs Growth Trajectory to Lift in H2FY25 Due to Resilient Domestic Consumption, Says RBI Bulletin

Publication Date: December 2023 | Source: Reserve Bank of India Bulletin

India‚Äôs growth trajectory is set to improve in the second half of 2024-25, primarily fueled by strong domestic private consumption.

Key insights from the RBI bulletin highlight significant factors contributing to India's economic outlook, amid ongoing challenges.

  • India's growth outlook is supported by resilient private consumption demand.
  • Record foodgrains production and momentum in rural demand are key drivers.
  • Sustained government spending on infrastructure is expected to foster growth.
  • The economy grew at its slowest pace in nearly two years, with a GDP growth of 5.4%.
  • Inflation remains a concern, exceeding the RBI‚Äôs target of 4%.
  • High prices have slowed demand, but easing food prices offer some relief.
  • Strong festival activity indicates recovering momentum in the economy.
‚ÄúHigh frequency indicators for the third quarter indicate that the Indian economy is recovering from the slowdown in Q2.‚Äù - RBI Bulletin

The RBI‚Äôs analysis suggests that while certain global factors pose risks, there is optimism about a recovery in India's economic performance.

item.title: Why American Airlines grounded all US flights for an hour on busy Christmas Eve - The Times of India
item.description:
Why American Airlines Grounded All US Flights for an Hour on Busy Christmas Eve

Date: December 24, 2023 Source: Times of India

On Christmas Eve, American Airlines caused a disruption in air travel by grounding all its flights across the United States for over an hour due to operational issues, impacting numerous travelers during one of the busiest travel days of the year.

  • The grounding occurred for about one hour, creating significant delays.
  • The disruption affected thousands of passengers and thousands of flights nationwide.
  • The decision was made to ensure safety and operational efficiency.
‚ÄúSafety is our top priority, and we made this decision to ensure that all operations are secure and reliable during peak travel times,‚Äù said an airline spokesperson.

This incident highlights the challenges and responsibilities airlines face during high-demand periods, emphasizing the importance of operational integrity and passenger safety.

item.title: BPCL begins Rs 6,100 cr pre-project activities on Andhra refinery - Business Standard
item.description:
BPCL begins Rs 6,100 cr pre-project activities on Andhra refinery

Publication Date: [Date not provided] Source: [Source not provided]

Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited (BPCL) has announced the start of pre-project activities for a greenfield refinery-cum-petrochemical complex in Andhra Pradesh, valued at Rs 6,100 crore. The company also secured NTPC‚Äôs reverse auction for solar projects.

Key Points

  • Approval for greenfield refinery-cum-petrochemical complex.
  • The project cost is Rs 6,100 crore.
  • Activities include land acquisition and environmental assessments.
  • BPCL won a solar project for 1,200 MW ISTS-connected capacity, emerging as the lowest bidder for 150 MW.
  • The solar project has a budget of Rs 756.45 crore and projected annual revenue of Rs 100 crore.
‚ÄúThis milestone highlights BPCL's commitment to advancing renewable energy initiatives and contributing to India‚Äôs clean energy transition.‚Äù

BPCL's shares rose by 0.9% following these announcements.

item.title: American Airlines, World's Largest, Grounds All US Flights On Christmas Eve - NDTV
item.description:
American Airlines Grounds All US Flights on Christmas Eve Due to Technical Glitch

Date: December 24, 2024 Source: Reuters

On Christmas Eve, American Airlines, the world's largest airline carrier, grounded all its flights in the United States due to a technical glitch. This disruption occurs during one of the busiest travel times of the year.

  • American Airlines faced a technical glitch leading to the grounding of all US flights.
  • The airline informed passengers of the situation and promised updates every 15 minutes.
  • Many passengers expressed frustration on social media about the cancellations and inconveniences.
  • Shares of American Airlines fell by 3.8% before market opening.
  • This incident follows a notable Microsoft outage that impacted various industries globally.
‚ÄúOur teams are working to resolve the issue as quickly as possible, and we apologize to our customers for the inconvenience.‚Äù - American Airlines

This incident highlights the vulnerabilities in airline operations during peak travel seasons, raising questions about the reliability of technological systems in critical infrastructure.

item.title: Medical devices maker Poly Medicure to focus on exports amid geopolitical shift | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Medical devices maker Poly Medicure to focus on exports amid geopolitical shift

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Mint

Indian medical equipment manufacturer Poly Medicure Ltd. is increasing its focus on export markets due to growing demand in the US and a global movement to diversify supply chains away from China.

  • Poly Medicure is responding to a global narrative of shifting technology from China.
  • The company has acknowledged significant demand in the US market.
  • Himanshu Baid, managing director, emphasizes the need for a bold approach in light of these shifts.
‚ÄúThe narrative is very clear globally, that people want to move technology away from China...‚Äù - Himanshu Baid

The strategic shift towards exports may help Poly Medicure align with changing international market dynamics while addressing increasing demands.

item.title: Motilal Oswal‚Äôs top 10 stock picks for 2025 - CNBCTV18

item.title: Ventive Hospitality IPO subscribed 9.80 times on Day 3; Check latest GMP, subscription status, other details | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Ventive Hospitality IPO Subscribed 9.80 Times on Day 3

Publication Date: December 24, 2023 Source: Live Mint

Luxury hospitality business developer Ventive Hospitality's initial public offering (IPO) received a strong response, closing at 9.80 times subscription on the final day.

Key Points:

  • The IPO aimed to raise ‚Çπ1,600 crore by offering 2.49 crore equity shares.
  • Non-Institutional Investors subscribed 13.85 times, while Qualified Institutional Buyers came in at 9.08 times.
  • The grey market premium (GMP) is currently ‚Çπ56 per share, indicating expected listing at ‚Çπ699.
  • The funds will be used to pay off borrowings and for general corporate purposes.
‚ÄúThe IPO raised ‚Çπ719.5 crore from anchor investors ahead of the public issue.‚Äù

Conclusion: The strong subscription rates indicate robust investor interest in Ventive Hospitality, with its shares expected to list on December 30.

item.title: Major Pi Network (PI) Update Concerning All Users: Details - CryptoPotato
item.description:
Major Pi Network Update Concerning All Users: Details

Publication Date: December 2024 Source: CryptoPotato

Pi Network has extended its migration deadline to January 31, 2025, frustrating users with repeated delays and a lack of communication about progress towards the open mainnet.

  • Migration deadline extended to January 31, 2025.
  • Developers have not provided updates on the open mainnet, creating skepticism in the community.
  • Despite promises, the mainnet launch has faced multiple delays over the past year.

‚ÄúExtend it until 2028 instead of month by month. Nobody believes this will actually launch anytime soon. Maybe when the bull run is over,‚Äù one X user stated.

Currently, 18 million users have completed KYC verifications, and 8 million have migrated to the mainnet, as Pi Network prepares for an anticipated open network launch in Q1 2025.

item.title: Unimech Aerospace IPO Day 2 Live Updates: Issue was subscribed 9.09x on the second day; Check GMP, subscription | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Unimech Aerospace IPO Day 2 Live Updates: Issue was subscribed 9.09x on the second day; Check GMP, subscription

Date: 24 Dec, 2024
Source: Live Mint

The Unimech Aerospace IPO has seen tremendous interest as it enters its second day of bidding. The price band has been set between ‚Çπ745-785 per share, with a public offer totaling ‚Çπ500 crore.

  • The IPO was subscribed 9.09x on the second day.
  • Non-Institutional Investors portion subscribed 12.07x.
  • Retail investors portion subscribed 10.30x.
  • The grey market premium (GMP) stands at ‚Çπ510.
  • Expected listing price of shares approximately ‚Çπ1,295, reflecting a premium of 64.97%.
The public issue of Unimech Aerospace was subscribed for 4,27,66,226 shares against the 47,04,028 shares available.

The overwhelming response signifies strong investor confidence in Unimech's business model and growth trajectory.
